message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,400,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it to be a valuable asset. Let me know what you think.
I appreciate your offer, but I'm looking to save some money on this deal. I'm willing to pay $1,200,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering the market value.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal.  Let's meet in the middle. I'm willing to come down to $1,300,000. It's still a great price for the product and leaves some room for negotiation.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $1,250,000 for the product. I think this is a reasonable price considering the market value.

Bob, I'm getting the feeling we're not going to see eye to eye on this price. I'm willing to go down to $1,350,000 as a final concession. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'm going to have to move on and sell to someone else.

I understand your concerns, but I'm still not willing to go above $1,250,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last offers, so I'll offer $1,275,000 for the product. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, this is my final offer. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1,325,000. This is a fair compromise, and it's the best I can do. If you reject this offer, I'm going to sell the product to John for $1,500,000. It's up to you.
